page.title: 18Spittle Farm
page.content: Michael and I interviewed Mrs. Spittle who has been farming for 23 years. The farm is a mixed farm with 300 acres of grass land and 120 acres of arable land. There are 380 Sheep and 30 calves which are for beef.To be a farmer you do not need a lot of qualifications, but you need a lot sense and patience and a love of the land and of animals. You have to be willing to work in all weather. Mrs.Spittle likes her job and says the advantage of working in Blockley are that it is quiet.The disadvantage is that the land is nearly all hilly.She employs one helper and her son specially when lambing. Mrs.Spittle does not know all the history of the farm.
